intro: Palicourea persearum, commonly known as the purple-flowered palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often glossy and dark green. Its most striking feature is its clusters of tiny, fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional remedies.
